item.title: Lost: Season 2
item.description:
John Locke: [screaming] What am I supposed to do?

And so my third watch of Lost continues!

Season 1 was all about the crash on the island. About survival, with only the beginnings of weirdness around the edges.

In Season 2? Now we’re really getting into it.

In Orientation, we get our first hints of the Hatch. Desmond is such a fun character, even if (spoilers!) he’s not in as much of this seasons as later ones. And oh, later on, we have Lockdown. Now that is a wonderful mystery of an episode. And the whole season does have an excellent dynamic between Jack and Locke. Man of Science. Man of Faith. (And really, which is which?)

John Locke: Why do you find it so hard to believe?!

Jack Shephard: Why do you find it so easy?!

John Locke: It’s never been easy!

We get a few new characters from the tail section (The Other 48 Days). Mr. Eko is such an intense foil to Locke in particular. And the

We do also get two amazing Hugo backstory centered episodes: Everybody Hates Hugo and Dave.

Hugo: Did either of you see a bald guy in slippers with a coconut come through here?

Charlie: No. But I did see a polar bear on roller skates with a mango.â€

He’s such a fun character, in spite (because?) of everything.

In Maternity Leave, we get a bit more about the medical mystery.

And then in the end… we Live Together, Die Alone.

Oh, I’m looking forward to Season 3!

item.title: Constantine
item.description: Recently I went through and read the entire (modern) catalogue of Hellblazer and rewatched The Matrix. So… let’s give the 2005 Constantine film another try!

item.title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
item.description: Revenge of the Sith is a somewhat fascinating story. It feels by far the darkest and most ‘adult’ of the prequel trilogy, probably best matching the feel of A New Hope and Empire Strikes Back, but at the same time, there’s a lot more humor in the early parts at least, with some truly weird and silly moments with R2 and the Battle Droids. You know… I just don’t understand the droids. I’ll get back to that in a bit.
